Module org.example.eiscuno
Package org.example.eiscuno.model.game

Class GameUno

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.game.GameUno
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGameUno
public class GameUno extends Object implements IGameUno
Represents a game of Uno. This class manages the game logic and interactions between players, deck, and the table.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts a new UNO game by distributing 5 cards to each player and placing an initial card on the table. Ensures that the initial card is not a special card (e.g., WILD, SKIP, +2).

      If the deck is empty during setup, the game will not start and an error message will be printed.

      Specified by:
      startGame in interface IGameUno

    • isSkipHumanTurn

      public boolean isSkipHumanTurn()
      Checks whether the human player's next turn should be skipped.
      Returns:
      true if the human player's turn is to be skipped, false otherwise

    • clearSkipHumanTurn

      public void clearSkipHumanTurn()
      Clears the skip flag for the human player, allowing them to take their next turn.

    • isSkipMachineTurn

      public boolean isSkipMachineTurn()
      Checks whether the machine player's next turn should be skipped.
      Returns:
      true if the machine player's turn is to be skipped, false otherwise

    • clearSkipMachineTurn

      public void clearSkipMachineTurn()
      Clears the skip flag for the machine player, allowing it to take its next turn.

    • drawCard

      public Card drawCard(Player player) throws EmptyDeckException
      Draws a card from the deck and adds it to the specified player's hand. If the deck is empty and no players can make a move, the game ends.

      Notifies any registered listener about changes in the player's hand.

      Parameters:
      player - the player drawing the card
      Returns:
      the drawn Card
      Throws:
      EmptyDeckException - if the deck is empty and a card cannot be drawn
      IllegalGameStateException - if the game has already ended

    • eatCard

      public void eatCard(Player player, int numberOfCards)
      Allows a player to draw a specified number of cards from the deck.
      Specified by:
      eatCard in interface IGameUno
      Parameters:
      player - The player who will draw cards.
      numberOfCards - The number of cards to draw.

      Parameters:

      Specified by:

    • canAnyPlayerPlay

      public boolean canAnyPlayerPlay()
      Checks whether any player (human or machine) has at least one card that can be legally played on the current top card of the table.
      Returns:
      true if at least one player can make a valid move, false otherwise
